714783f-a.title: Manhattan: 89th Street (East) - Madison Avenue
714783f-a.text:
East 89th Street, north side, east from Madison, te Park Aves. The
view shows the Beloved Disciple P.E. Church and Rectory.
June 21, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
The New York Times of August 3, 1939, in a note on the sale of the
Reformed Low Dutch Church of Harlem, at the N. W. corner of Lenox Avenue
and J. 123rd Street, refers to the purchase in 1929 of the church building
here shown, by the above identified group. These individuals, descendants
of the early Dutch,,occupied the Lenox Avenue structure from the date of
its construction by them; 1888.

714784f-a.title: Manhattan: 89th Street (East) - Madison Avenue
714784f-a.text:
The Chapel of the Beloved Disciple, 63 East 89th Street,
adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of Madison Ave. Thds
chapel occupies the same site as the Church of the Heavenly Rest
but is separate from it, both of them are Protestant Episcopal.
March 28, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
